text: James Budd was an American Democratic Party politician who served as governor of California from 1895 to 1899. During his time as governor a new banking act was introduced while laws were made to prohibit adulteration of drinks, foods, and drugs, and also to aid the dairy industry.The Encyclopaedia of California By Somerset Publishers, Incorporated, 1999, P.140 ==References== Category:Governors of California Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians
title: James Budd
